sub_title: Project Manager Sustainability @ Leger des Heils
summary: My name is Wesley, I started as an Aviation Engineer but am now working in sourcing and change management projects within real estate. Until recently I also worked voluntarily as an elder in an Evangelical Church. Through my knowledge of technology and organizational psychology I manage to bring people together and motivate them to implement innovative solutions and ideas. I do this by positive thinking, being approachable and solution oriented. My qualities lie in making the mission and vision tangible to the colleagues around me through my communication skills and translating ambition to technical solutions and projects. In addition, I am a strategic thinker, analytical and a real process improver in order to help the organization and the people in their goals. Because the latter, that's where I draw my energy!

projects.title: Shortfilm "Open"​ door Kids4life.tv voor the 48 Hour Film Project
projects.description: Volunteer composer soundtrack, editor and designer of the movie poster for the kids4life.tv 48 Hour Film Project: ‘OPEN’. This film was completely written, recorded and edited within a time span of 48 hours. The goal of this project was to create the best short film geared to children within 48 hours against several other teams. ‘OPEN’ was then displayed and rated at the yearly CINEKID festival at Amsterdam. ‘OPEN’ received a nomination for the best movie poster.

contributors.headline: Project Manager Sustainability @ Leger des Heils

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for sustainability projects, expert team sustainability and sustainability program of the Salvation Army Netherlands (Leger des Heils). Next to ensuring compliancy to EU and NL rules and regulatory, notable projects include:
- Implementation of a Paris-proof energymanagement and reporting system
- Certification of over fifty locations according to the MTZ-Brons certification (Milieu Thermometer Zorg)
- Solar-projects
- Energy saving projects to accelerate reducing power consumption on twenty locations
- Compliance of 92 locaties according to the 'Portefeuille Aanpak' of the RVO

Leger des Heils is commited to reduce it's CO2-footprint by 50% in 2030 and 100% in 2050 in comparison to 2018. This is further carried out by it's commitment to the Green Deal Sustainable Healthcare 3.0, which it signed in 2022.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Sustainability

profile_positions.description: Assistant Program Manager within the real estate department of Albert Schweitzer Hospital. Working on strategic sourcing trajects within the program that facilitates the ownership transition of 4 buildings (40.000m2 + assets) from Albert Schweitzer Hospital to NorthWest Healthcare Properties. This includes all issues related to the (technical) unbundling of contracts, energy, water, gas, cold/warmth/climate & processes between all stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Program Manager Real Estate

profile_positions.description: The Yacht Engineering Traineeship is a three year program that focuses on the development of technical young professionals into specialists with management skills. During this traineeship the trainee will work on approximately three projects for one to three clients. This allows the Trainee to take on various roles and gain valuable work experience. In addition to these assignments, trainees will be coached and trained by Yacht's #SchoolofWork (in collaboration with Ken & Ben) to help them develop their soft skills. Besides the soft skill training, the Trainee will be able to follows various hard skill trainings that support him in daily work.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Trainee

profile_positions.description:
Regional Manager during the rapid scale-up of corona test facilities in Utrecht, Noord-Holland, Overijssel, Gelderland, Drenthe, Leeuwarden and Groningen. These test facilities with a total test capacity of 120.000+ Antigen Test per day were built and used for the 'Testen voor Toegang' pilot by the Dutch Government via Stichting Nederland Open. The aim of this pilot was to open up activities such as concerts, festivals, museums, monuments etc. to the public via testing people before entrance to these activities. We were also the sole test-partner for the Euro Songfestival. Next to these facilities over 100 test facilities were reserved for commercial tests via the Dutch Government Initiative 'Testen voor je Reis' ('Test before your Travel') and Lead Healthcare Covid Services B.V.. Combined these facilities had a total test-capacity of 40.000+ PCR-tests a day. All initiatives were connected to the Dutch Government CoronaCheck-app. 

As Regional Manager of around 15 small to large test locations and 30 connected BENU Pharmacies, I was responsible over the test locations facilities and over the employees working at these locations. I was also the first point of contact for all facility managers, teamleads &  medical supervisors about questions around planning, human resources, facilities, process, improvements, communication etc. This also included contact with secondmendment bureau's, IT-teams, HQ and third parties. Furthermore, as Regional Manager I was constantly aiming to improve the supply chain and communication in this rapid changing environment of corona testing. 
In the course of my last month, this included a rapid re-structuring of the whole Lead Covid Services B.V. organisation structure, which was led by me and a colleague to ensure a smooth transition to a new organisation without the need of us, regio managers (and other key-roles). This included all connected departments (internal & external) and roles.
profile_positions.title: Regional Operations Manager Corona Test Facilities

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the design, coordination, installation preparations and testing of electrical low-voltage installations in modern industrial projects. With the focus on the data centers industry. During my time at Siemens I've worked abroad on-site as engineer for one international datacenter project in Switserland and completed 3 busbar projects in the Netherlands and Ireland. On two projects I doubled as the responsible project manager and engineer.

In addition, I am also responsible for business analysis on data management and process management projects within the department. Here I look at the use and integration of new IT systems such as Cloud computing, Sharepoint, Dynamics and SAP within our processes. In my research, I weigh up the needs and wishes of the customer (the department) and what is possible with systems on the market, or the alternative to develop software in-house.
profile_positions.title: Busbar Engineer Electrical-Mechanical | Project lead | Analyst
Real Estate Project Lead & Researcher

company.name: Air France Industries KLM Engineering & Maintenance

profile_positions.company: Air France Industries KLM Engineering & Maintenance
profile_positions.description:
Researched about 'MRO 4.0 - Airframe Maintenance in the future'. Researching and discovering new disruptive technologies and coupling these to business developments and strategic points of KLM E&M. This was combined together with asking and researching employees on the subject (workshops, depth-interviews & surveys) and benchmarks and interviews with other companies as NLR, GE, NS/NedTrain, Koning & Hartman, AFI and Twente University. The research ended up into a top 3 set of disruptive technologies which were compiled into a strategic vision and technology/vision roadmap for airframe maintenance in 2030 that was then presented to KLM E&M at the end of the research.

The thesis was granted a 9 as final grade from the examiners at the AUAS.

"The MRO Lab" is a program where all the innovations developed by AFI KLM E&M and its network of affiliates converge. Specially tailored to the challenges of aircraft maintenance, the innovations are the fruit of continuous development aimed at satisfying the requirements of airline operating performance.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Intern 'The MRO Lab'

company.name: Air France Industries KLM Engineering & Maintenance

profile_positions.company: Air France Industries KLM Engineering & Maintenance
profile_positions.description:
Helping and learning about the whole phase-out process of KLM E&M (especially the Boeing 747-400 phase-out) and find and report possible changes to make the process more LEAN, if any. In addition helping with starting the Central Record Keeping process (one-click phase-out). This includes, but is not limited to: creating workflows and work instructions, making program structures, setting agreements with connected parties and departments.

This internship and report was granted a 9 as final grade from the supporting lecturer of the AUAS and company supervisor (KLM E&M).

Projects:
- LEANING phase-out process 
- Central Record Keeping
profile_positions.title: Intern Records & Documentation Department

volunteer_experiences.description:
Supporting the band as pianist during Sunday service, with a minimum of once every 3 weeks. In addition to provide child care and education for children during Sunday school (aged 5-9 years), also with a minimum of once every 3 weeks.

www.evangeliegemeentehouten.nl

Volunteer organizer and (main) leader of PUURweekend 2017, 2018, 2019 & 2020. PUURweekend is a yearly event with over 45 youth (ages 12-25) by the Evangelie Gemeente Houten and covers 3 days. Preparations for the PUURweekend start 6 months prior.
